programme.title: L'avenir nous appartient
programme.desc: Episode 8 Fred Pellerin has just launched the FOC certification for produce made in Saint-Élie-de-Caxton. Should feminine hygiene products be subsidised? Stéphane Lemire has enabled over seven thousand elderly citizens to continue living at home. Ghayda Hassan is working to prevent violent radicalization. La Tablée des Chefs redistributes surplus food. Directed by: Jean-François Poisson (Canada, 2021)

programme.title: Le vrai nouveau monde
programme.desc: More of a Quebecker than you might think Annick Bissainthe, 27 years old, arrived in Quebec as a teenager. She still remembers her native island of Haiti, and continues to feel somewhat isolated. Originally from Hungary, 44 year-old Akos Verbocky, considers himself a Quebecker from another land. In 2017 he published his thoughts on the theme of integration. Directed by: Sophie Lambert (Canada, 2019) With Gregory Charles

programme.title: Destinations
programme.desc: Arles and Van Gogh, its colours and his madness Arles is today indissociable from the work of the Dutch painter Vincent Van Gogh. It was on its riverbanks that he painted some of his most beautiful masterpieces, such as the vibrant sunflower series. Shimmering colours that, along with the limpid skies he observed, ignited his creative ener-gy.

programme.title: C Jamy
programme.desc:
Quebec: all the secrets of the "Belle Province"
It's both the name of a city and a province the French adore, and for good reason, everyone speaks French: Quebec. But why do Quebeckers speak the language of Moliere? What is the history of the region? And how to use some of the best expressions unique to Quebec?
Presented by: Jamy Gourmaud.

programme.title: Quand l'histoire fait dates
programme.desc:
14 May 1610, assassination of Henri IV/11 September 1973, the other 11 September
The assassination of King Henri IV, peacemaker and reformer, precipitated a major evolution, sanctifying the royal state. Before its memory was shrouded by the terrorist attacks of 2001, 11 September referred to the coup d'état by Chilean armed forces, overthrowing the socialist Popular Unity government and driving Allende to suicide.
Directed by: Pascal Goblot, Denis Van Waerebeke (France, 2019-2020)

programme.title: C Jamy
programme.desc:
Quebec: all the secrets of the "Belle Province"
It's both the name of a city and a province the French adore, and for good reason, everyone speaks French: Quebec. But why do Quebeckers speak the language of Moliere? What is the history of the region? And how to use some of the best expressions unique to Quebec?
Presented by: Jamy Gourmaud.

programme.title: Rocky & Lily : c'est dans la boîte !
programme.desc:
Allergies
It's springtime and so is hay fever... But where do allergies come from? Which are the most common?
Directed by: Angelo Abou Hatem (season 2, Belgium, 2021) With Aurélie Martinez and Romain Angeveld

programme.title: Petits arrangements avec les morts
programme.desc:
It's the story of a sandcastle, of the man building it and of those who watch, on a beach in Brittany. All have had to learn to live with the loss of someone close…

Directed by: Pascale Ferran (France, 1994)

Cast: Charles Berling, Didier Sandre, Alexandre Zloto

Genre: Drama

Awards: Caméra d'Or (Cannes 1994), Bayard d'Or (FIFF Namur 1994)

programme.title: Faits divers
programme.desc:
Episode 5

The police identify those who tried to kill Sylvain, two brothers, Mathieu and Dwayne Henri. But who pulled the strings? Constance is now concentrating all her attention on Mike Pratt. During Nancy's funeral, he breaks down and wants to tell the investigators all he knows...

Directed by: Stéphane Lapointe (season 1, Canada, 2017)

Screenplay: Joanne Arseneau

Cast: Isabelle Blais (Constance Forest), Fred-Éric Salvail (Antoine Chevrier-Marseau), Émile Proulx-Cloutier (Frédérik Bérubé), Maxime Mailloux (Jonas), Fabien Cloutier (Mike Pratt), Mylène Mackay (Marlène Charbonneau), David Boutin (Éric Charbonneau), Marie-Ève Beaulieu (Anne Dupuis), Patrick Hivon (Sylvain Lauzon), Alexa-Jeanne Dubé (Zoé Forest), Francis LaHaye (Joël Savard), Guy Nadon (Serge Forest)

Genre: thriller

Awards: best performance by an actor in a leading role in a dramatic series (Fabien Cloutier) at the 2018 Gémeaux

Parental guidance: not recommended for children under the age of 10 (-10)

programme.title: Faits divers
programme.desc:
Episode 6

Frédérik questions Sylvain. He is convinced that Rodrigue Rancourt's body is in the boot of Sylvain's car. Is he about to be accused of murder? Meanwhile, Mike Pratt meets Marlène, Éric and Chose-Pet. But things don't go as planned and the surveillance team has to intervene...

Directed by: Stéphane Lapointe (season 1, Canada, 2017)

Screenplay: Joanne Arseneau

Cast: Isabelle Blais (Constance Forest), Fred-Éric Salvail (Antoine Chevrier-Marseau), Émile Proulx-Cloutier (Frédérik Bérubé), Maxime Mailloux (Jonas), Fabien Cloutier (Mike Pratt), Mylène Mackay (Marlène Charbonneau), David Boutin (Éric Charbonneau), Marie-Ève Beaulieu (Anne Dupuis), Patrick Hivon (Sylvain Lauzon), Alexa-Jeanne Dubé (Zoé Forest), Francis LaHaye (Joël Savard), Guy Nadon (Serge Forest)

Genre: thriller

Awards: best performance by an actor in a leading role in a dramatic series (Fabien Cloutier) at the 2018 Gémeaux

Parental guidance: not recommended for children under the age of 10 (-10)

programme.title: Quand l'histoire fait dates
programme.desc:
1348 BC, the Akhenaton event/17 October 1961, a colonial massacre in Paris
Between the years IV and VI of his reign, the Pharaoh Amenhotep IV changed religion and name to become Akhenaton. Responding to a call by the FLN, 20 to 30,000 Algerians peacefully marched through Paris. What followed was the most violent state repression provoked by a street demonstration in Europe.
Directed by: Florence Tran, Juliette Garcias (France, 2020)
